message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.MA 

The paper deals with game theory and the concept of coinduction, which are both central to the cs.GT (Game Theory) sub-category. The use of coinduction also suggests a connection to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category, as this concept is often used in the design of intelligent agents. The paper also involves formal proofs, which could place it in the cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) sub-category. The use of infinite computations and the study of behavior in this context could also relate to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. Finally, the mention of modeling and the comparison to Newton suggests a connection to the cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) sub-category, which deals with the study of interactions between multiple agents.
